comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content:
I'm pretty sure Mr. Unidentified is Hub Perdue.  Compare:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5853173868/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The negative caption indicates that Art Fletcher was a New York player, but the Flickr caption says the players are from the Cardinals. Fletcher's bio: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Art_Fletcher confirms that he was a Giants player.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: artolog: Good catch! Art Fletcher was definitely a New York Giant, so we'll make sure the caption is corrected to reflect that. rjones0856: I do think Hub Perdue has some resemblance to the unidentified player, but I don't think it's a match. Here are other images of Perdue from our holdings. His ears stick out quite a bit, and the unidentified player does not share that characteristic. Your suggestion made me curious if I could find a match for the unidentified player, however. I reviewed the roster of the St. Louis Cardinals for 1914, since we can see that from his uniform that he's a Cardinal, and checked for portraits of players in our collections. Working my way through the roster, I found photographs of nearly every player and I think I found a match for the unidentified player in outfielder Lee Magee. This photograph of Magee as well as these others show a lot of good matching facial characteristics. Thanks to all for the close looking, as always!

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Yeah, that really looks like Magee.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: I'll buy that.  I was going by his unibrow and spade-shaped nose, but when I looked at the full size those aren't as impressive in this photo as I thought.
